job_title: Federal Student Worker in Tempe, AZ
pros: Really enjoyed helping out with classes I took previously took, which was a good review for my boards.
cons: Could not work more than allotted hours for the quarter.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Tempe, AZ
pros: Helping an watching students learn, working with a team of thoughtful doctors
cons: Low-Mid pay, but more than average workload, Constantly changing work processes, High turnover, Little support from higher ups when management want to make improvements.

pros: Clinical learning , skill refinement and mentorship were great
cons: Poor leadership in administration. Lack in honest communication
Not following through with their promises, also does not support the student body.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Tempe Camp, AZ
pros: The students and the discount at the medical center.
cons: This was the most mentally unhealthy place I have worked in my life. The staff meetings were very disfuctional, old fashioned and just plain bizar. The employees and managers were nitpickey with one another and were two faced with one another. The entire organization needs to go to codependents anonymous or Al-anon.

pros: Good place to develop skills, begin learning about an education environment, and managing workloads. It is not a corporate environment and no micromanaging. Students are friendly, great benefits, and the mission of the school is something to be very proud of.
cons: For a place that practices holistic health, it tends to overwork the people who are there. There isn't quite a structure and the staff whether it be stress or their own agenda will turn on each other. There is not a sense of community among people who work there and you tend to feel overwhelmed and underappreciated. The worse thing I've seen is the office politics in upper management.  The environment is not transparent and the structure is ever changing with it's employees. It lacks a true vision moving it into the 21st century.

review_title: Get your financial expectations in check
job_title: Creative Services Production Specialist in Tempe, AZ
pros: Great people to work with! Alot of women have a "mother-hen" type of bond/attitude. Would still be there if I was paid what they told me I was suppose to.
cons: Marketing budget is 1/2 what is needed to fulfill the admissions goals. Its 1/3 what is needed to fulfill the Medical Centers goals. No raises ever. Only get more compensation if you get a 'promotion' and that for the inner high management circle. Fired 9 nationally recognized Dr's for financial reasons. Huge turnover.

review_title: great people and students, fast paced atmosphere
pros: You never get bored as the organization is constantly changing and developing. The main thing is the job is never boring as students constantly have issues they need resolved. It keeps you on your toes and makes you think outside of the box. Plus, you really develop work independence and little micromanaging is needed. People who work there are friendly.
cons: Management is always changing. You never know what department you will fall under and who your boss is going to be and for how long. Although people are friendly, everyone is scared to make lasting relationships because the turn over rate is common.

review_title: Some great people, heavy turnover, poor management at the top
pros: There a lot of great people, especially the middle managers.  Good experience and variety each day.
cons: There was a ton of turnover be it good people quitting out of frustration or good people being let go for seemingly no reason.  This was from the top of the organization, the managers and staff were not the issue.  Seemed to be a throw darts blindfolded approach to overcoming challenges and this included letting people go randomly just thinking that making any change would solve issues.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Tempe, AZ
pros: Learn lots of stuff about natural medicine. Easy work without a lot of responsibility.  No weekends, vacation time if full time. Discounts also.
cons: Lots of phone calls to answer. Some of the employees are not so happy to be there. May need to change careers.

pros: Good experience working while a student. Flexible hours and become more familiar with lab procedures and specialty lab tests.
cons: Can be understaffed at times leading to back up when multiple doctors want patients processed at the same time.
